text: Here we are in Vermont and the Alchemist is around the corner. The aroma is hoppy to the nth degree filtering out of the can like a testicle popping out of a too tight zipped pair of pants. The appearance is a hazy dank VT style resin bomb. The taste is a glorious blizzard of hop fury, complete with a smooth finish for a 9%er, resiny, dank, citrus, all the goodness. This is a glorious testament to the power of the hop. Good for chilling wit yo homies in VT before Jacking in the box (talking about the Jackbox Party Pack, not the fast food chain, or a dirty reference). BOOM!

Can shared with friends. Well what a treat. Dank hop aroma. Pine, resinous hops. The hops burn into the brain. Dank, citrus medium sweet flavour. Strong bitter finish. Lasting bitter finish. Another great beer.

1 pint can. Pours very hazy, golden yellow with a thick off white frothy head. Thick full look with some residue at the bottom of the glass. Smells citrusy hoppy with some pine and resin. Some pineapple and mango with a bit of malts as well. Smooth earthiness as well. Very hoppy and bitter taste. Nice resin and pineyness throughout. Some citrus and bright fruits but mostly bitter. Thick full mouthfeel, great frothy carbonation and a long lingering bitter aftertaste. Overall not as fruity and citrusy as I usually like them but a very good strong hop flavor. Lovely.

First time having the crusher. Very good double IPA. The hops don't overpower the aroma the way a lot of double IPAs do.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a very cloudy pineapple with foamy eggshell head. Smells juicy, bitter, and grassy with notes of pineapple and grapefruit alongside a big bittersweet backbone. A bit of green onion as well. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly bitter medium full-bodied mouthfeel thats mildly warming, but smooth. Tasty, but definitely bigger and less sessionable than Focal and Heady.

Thanks to Rich and Jeff for the share. Can, pours a hazy golden color with small white head. Softly carbonated with particulates. Heavy citrusy hoppy aroma. Super citrusy with a touch of piney hops as well. Mostly mellow bitterness. Medium bodied with lingering bitter finish. Very good.

Can crushed all by myself. Hazy orange golden with white head. Loads of lovely fruity hops with orange, grapefruit, mango, passionfruit, light marijuana and a hint of cheese. Theres quite some sweet malts, but theres a nice caramel and soft hazelnut aroma to it as well. Quite sweet and bitter. Well actually its really sweet and bitter but they balance each other out a bit. Almost full bodied. This is really well done, Id say the best high abv IPA Ive ever had. Really good!

Can 1pt. @ [ Scooper Tasting ], Ulfborg, Denmark. [ As Alchemist The Crusher ].ABV: 9.0%. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, tropical fruit, citrus, grapefruit, dry, crispy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20170303]
 8-4-8-4-17

Can from trade. Pours a clear golden yellow with lots of hop sediment, white foam head... Aroma of citrus, pineapple, mango... Flavor is slightly grassy and herbal, lots of tropical fruits, mango, citrus... Some dank and juicy hops on palate... Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Frothy white head. Light amber golden color. Tons of muscat grape, grapefruits and modest esters. Medium full body with big malt backbone on top of brimming hops. Almost sticky mouthfeel. Pineapples, muscat and grapefruit burst across the mouth. Slightly boozy. Not perfectly fresh but I can imagine this would be one of the best iiipas when fresh. One of the more malty NE IIPAs Ive had but so awesome.

Can
Aroma- fruits
Appearanace-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Canette. Merci Tommy! Robe jaunâtre trouble surmontée dun col de mousse blanc cassé et où mijotent plusieurs grosses particules. Arômes de cocktail à lorange, kiwi, mangue et résine de pin. Beaucoup de pamplemousse juteux aussi, salade de fruits Del Monte©. Très aromatiques, on se croirait dans une orangeraie de la Floride. En bouche, une tonne dorange et son zeste, mangue ainsi que dautres agrumes orangés. Goût assez résineux et liquoreux, présence moyenne de lalcool sur un fond damertume de pamplemousse. Finale assez sèche et moins fruitée que les autres grosses ipa de la brasserie. Texture huileuse, limite liquoreuse et corps moyen.
Pours hazy gold with an off-white head. Aroma is resin, citrus, floral and more citrus. Taste is bittersweet, some citrus juiciness that adds a bit of tartness. Medium bodied, sticky yet dry finish.
Can at home. Semi-hazy golden pour with a thin white head. Notes of tropical fruit, harsh herbal bitterness, cat piss, unripe passion fruit, alcohol. Not the best imperial IPA.

Hazy orange appearance with a sweet peach/apricot aroma. Medium body. Much dryer and more crisp than Heady or Focal with a similar abundance of hops

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy golden orange pour with a bright white head. Aroma is peach, resin, and dank. Taste follows the nose and some booze and is on the sweet side. Medium body.

Tasted from can. Pours a golden orange with thick white head. Tons of sediment. Aroma is super fruity. Lots of orange, lemon, passionfruit, papaya, and grapefruit. Taste is moderately bitter but well balanced. Flavors of citrus fruit, floral and resin. Complex and excellent tasting. Goes down super easy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opaque copper/dark orange; turbid as fucktons of suspended sediment from top to bottom. Aromas bursting with tropical fruits: papaya, passion, & orange. Some honey & floral notes on the nose as well. Tastes malty and sweet with orange juice filling the palate; a bit of papaya & dried apricots come up, too. Moderate bitter citrus zest at the finish. Actually quite full-bodied for a freaking DIPA! Medium carb & finishes dry. So crushable cause it hides the booze so damn well! What a fantastic DIPA!!

Bottled, thanks Brothers Beer Bistro staff!  Lightly hazy deep golden, mid sized head. Dank pear and grapefruit aroma. Sweet with medium-full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Peach, mango, citrus and syrup. Long bitter finish.
When i tried this "can" after the first sip i felt like half of my head melted and my soul elevated to another level. I hop(e) this helps...

@Ulfborg Scooper. Slightly hazy, white froth. Piney aroma, fruity with light notes of caramel. Smooth flavour at first, then comes a very pleasant, strong bitterness. Warm, solid, caramely and piney bitterness. Very crushable.

Can, 9%. Hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, caramel, grapefruit and earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, medium sweet, pine, little earthy and bitter.
Can @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 030317
Can @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden and has floaties. Aroma and taste are rich grapefruit, hops, flowers, fruits, malt and has a nice fruity hoppy finish.

Boks (gave til Steven fra amerikansk venn), og delt med ham: uklar oransjegylden med fint skum. Intens, begeistret, inviterende og balansert aroma og smak med tropiske frukter som mango, ananas, lychee. Herlig, fruktig avslutning uten å bli hverken for søt eller sterk, bare elegant og superlekker. Life is indeed good. 9.0% iflg. boksen.

Sampled from a can at home shared with Holmen1 - thanks Steve Shires! Pours a hazy orange gold with a heavy sediment. Great tropical fruit aromas and an enticing taste of mango, lime, lemon, and orange peel. Notes of pine resin also. Great mouthfeel and very good dry finish. Fruity and very tasty without sweetness. A really great DIPA. Highly drinkable.
Pounder->SA from friend Paul. A: lovely citrus and floral hops, mild spice. T: pine and floral hops, mild citrus. Dank and juicy. Great.

Orange pour, Bright and a lil cloudy.
Aroma of big pine and citrus. Some earth. More balanced flavor and aroma than expected, but its a goodn.

Can, 1 pint, savoured on July 19 2016; eye: caramel with a milky hue, hazy, ring of tan head, light lacing; nose: hops, pine, citrusy, citrus fruits, slight caramel, green; mouth: hops, pine, citrusy, citrus fruits, slight caramel, green, mild astringency, dry finale in pine with good presence of citrus fruits, average carbonation, quite bitter, slightly sweet, harsh texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Canette, 1 pinte, savourée le 19 juillet 2016; il : caramel avec une teinte laiteuse, trouble, anneau de mousse fauve, légère dentelle; nez : houblon, pin, citrique, agrumes, très léger caramel, vert; bouche : houblon, pin, citrique, agrumes, très léger caramel, vert, astringence moyenne, finale sèche en pin avec bonne présence dagrumes, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, pas mal amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture râpeuse; en résumé : bien bon
Can. Orange colour with white head. Citric and pien aroma. Citric, pine, caramel taste, some sweetness. Medium body.
can. On the darker side of amber, with a firm head. Huge hop aroma, mainly pine and grapefruit, some wet hops and dankness. Somewhat sticky, loads of bitterness. Nice stuff.

Out of the can. Aroma is insane. Hops, grass, foliage, citrusy. Very intense. Pours (but don't pour it) very cloudy amber. Finishes well - sheep. Excellent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from can thanks Airforcehops nice hazy orange color with lots of floaties and a nice white head. Aromas of floral hops dank citrus and grassy pine. Taste is tropical fruit grapefruit pine nice viscous texture. Nice.

Type: 16-oz. can
Glass: Beer Nerd tulip
From: My friend Charlie 
Price: $3.13 (educated guess)
Purchased: N/A; Received Jan. 27, 2017
Consumed: Feb. 3, 2017
Reviewed as: American Double / Imperial IPA 
Misc.: No COD

Was lucky enough to get 10 pretty sweet beers sent to me by a college buddy. Was really looking forward to this one, having head Heady Topper a few times and Focal Banger the other night. Expecting to be in the 4.40-to-4.55 range. 

Poured a light-to-medium yellow hazy color with 2-to-3 fingers of rocky white head. Lots of bubble streams coming up along the sides of the glass. Excellent foamy lacing. Almost perfect foamy retention. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled Citra, Cascade, juicy grapefruit, mango, pineapple, peach, tangerine, floral, herbal mints, hints of menthol and sugary candy. (Smell - 4.25)

Tasted a little better version of the smell. Very sugary like I expected. Got Citra, Cascade, juicy grapefruit, mango, pineapple, tangerine, herbal grass, leafy hops, floral, unknown spices, mint, booze, passion fruit, sharp pine, lemon zest and lime. (Taste - 4.25)

Medium body. Sticky texture. Lively carbonation. Sugary, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.25)

This was very good, just two sweet for me overall. Reminded me slightly of a Todd the Axe Man, but not nearly as good. (Overall - 4.25)

4.27 95 A

Chalky hazed golden color with a strong white head. Sticky piney aroma. Moderately sweet and sticky with a piney hop dominance, but not obtrusive; flavors blend well.

Notes: On tap at the brewery Dec 16

Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet malt and mild hop bitterness. Taste is bitter, very bitter hops, big malt and a mild alcohol burn. Wow this is hoppy. You wouldnt think from the nose but it like a sneak attack of hop bitterness

473ml can (1 pint). Pour hazy orange with a tall dense long lasting white foam. Aroma of pineapple and green hops. Taste is resinous, green and bitter. Creamy and oily texture, high carbonation, dry and high body.
Can at home. Hazy and golden with quite a bit of floaties and a big white head. Aroma is tropical fruits and pine, taste is tropical fruits, pine, grapefruit and some herbal notes.

Can - 1 pint. Beautiful, hazy golden body with a thin, lasting, white foamy head. Lovely hoppy aroma with tropical fruits, citrusy, and mango hints. Its robust, sharp hoppy taste carries citrusy, herbal, and woody/grainy notes. Ends with a long, sharp, moderately warming, bitter finish. Wonderful!

Can at home. Cloudy amber with plenty of floaties and big white head. Aroma of sweet onions, a little cake and pear puree. Hoppy yet mellow bitterness, easy to drink with a little bit of onion and no hint of alcohol. Full body, well carbonated, fruity and a little dank finish. Great.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 Can sample at kerenmks place. Hazy golden with floaties and a white head. Lovely fruity hops aroma, a bit oniony. Flavor has light sweetish maltiness and bitter fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Very nice. Easy-drinking for 9%.

Nice dank herbal IPA here. Hazy light orange pour, 2 fingers of head and webs of lace. Dank aroma, pine, resin, caramel. Pine and orange up front, weed, citrus peel, caramel like malt balances this nicely. Medium body, slick mouthfeel.

Tasted on 12/14/16 from a 16oz can, huge thanks to Jules for this one. Pours cloudy, but bright orange with a thick, beige head that slowly recedes to thick, uneven lace. The nose is tons of dank herbal hops with some grass, a decent amount of pine resin, orange oil, and quite a bit of caramel malt. The flavor is about the same, dominated by the dank resin, grass, orange oil, and somewhat sweet malt balancing. The body is nearly full, oily in texture, with average carbonation, and a long, dank, somewhat bitter, caramel balanced finish.

Very light straw colour (mostly base malt?), thin white head. Light haze with globs of what Im assuming is yeast. This can is two months old, yeast has probably settled. Still potent aroma of citrus and resin. Matching flavour with a peachy character, somewhat sweet (probably from the higher ABV). Medium light body with a bitter finish. Slight heat.

Many cans of this were consumed over the summer and autumn months this year. Several of these were consumed sitting around campfires throughout New England. A bitter hotter than Focal Banger and Heady Topper. Full bodied with dank, hop resins. Juicy with medium-high bitterness. Really solid beer, though its my third favorite of the Alchemist trio.

Can shared by Sean. Thanks man! It pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is nicely balanced with flowers, peach and citrus. The flavor is the same with some tropical and stone fruit along with some pleasant flowery notes. Nice creamy body with a juicy finish. Delicious. This one lives up to the hype for me.

Tall can at Ilyas (thx, Chris!). Pours a hazy golden with a huge white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, some guelder rose notes. Taste is pretty the same with moderate sweetness. Fruity bitterness aftertaste. Very good!

Une bière orangée, franchement trouble, avec une belle ligne de mousse qui tient au fil des gorgées. Au nez, cest des agrumes, particulièrement le citron, qui retiennent lattention, avec un petit côté terreux ensuite qui annonce une certaine amertume digne des meilleures Heady Topper. Au goût, les agrumes sont assez présentes avec un certain goût de pêche assez présent. Une certaine amertume est également présente sans toutefois prendre le dessus sur le liquide. Un petit côté alcoolisé est présent en finale, laissant un très bel équilibre à cette bière.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Shared can at kermis courtesy of svartvit. Hazy orangey golden with white head. Big dank marijuana hoppiness. Citrus peels. Medium sweet and over medium bitter. Medium body, average carbonation. Strong fruity, hoppy and yeasty finish.

Can shared. Very hazy orange with floaters and an off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruits, peach. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Can shared. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is straight up hops, piney resiny dank hop goodness. Citrus, grass and a slight bit of booze. Great.
Pours a cloudy murky yellow with an small amount a foam. The aroma is grass, citrus and alcohol. A little bit of an alcohol burn

Canette. Un classique du Vermont. Une robe dorée foncée orangée. Un nez intense dagrumes, de malt sucré et dalcool. Une bouche ronde, sucrée avec des saveurs dagrumes, de résine de houblon et de malt sucrée. Bien faite mais un peu décadent. 9,0% sur la canette.

Halloween 2016 - Can share at Rich Street - much appreciated Matteo! As Alchemist The Crusher, 9%. Hazy orange, sparkling, foamy dense off-white head. Aroma is mostly pez sweets with some sherbet, Love Hearts sweets, touch of chive. Body is light, tingly to spritzy carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is pine and grapefruit, dusty dryness, touch of papery booze showing up, spicy finish. A good DIPA. (3.7)
On tap at brewery. Pours hazy copper color with off white head. Aroma is juicy citrus. Flavor citrus grapefruit and pine resin. Oily mouthfeel. Delicious!

16 oz can shared by DCLawyer with GenDV138, courtesy of jc1762. Thanks Jon! Poured a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Aroma was nice citrus notes. Flavor was nice resin, pine, floral character. Lots of hop leaf comes through. Tasty.

Can. Thanks Drew! Hazy gold with a frothy off white head that lasts in a ring mostly and laces. Aromas of grapefruit, lemon, melon, pine, yeast, toasted malt, dank/herbal notes. Flavor is the same with citrus and tropical notes followed by pine and yeast and malt finishing with dank and more yeast. Medium bodied, juicy and smooth with a dry and bitter end.

16 oz can shared by DCLawyer with radagast83, courtesy of jc1762. Thanks Jon! Hazy orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral, malt. Tastes of citrus, pine, resin, floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish.

Draft sample (one of a few!), at the brewery in Stowe. Hazy, bright gold. Swirly, sticky, lasting, white head. Nose has super fresh, green and oily hop leaf. Notes of citrus zest and oil. As it warms theres some tropical fruit. Taste is rich and sweet, turning oily, zesty bitter. Medium to full body. More of the hop oil. Feels the whole 9.6%. Some resinous characteristics build and linger at the end. Could have more pop and less warmth for me.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours hazy pale golden colour with a huge most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of intense fruity hops, apricot, peach, very fresh. Taste of intense bitter hops, apricot, some resins, long bitter duration, very good!

Pours a hazy golden color with a large white head. Nose of peaches, pineapple caramel malts, pine, mango. Theres a ton of aromas there. At first the taste is sweet and very full bodied. Then you get the lingering hoppiness that kicks in and after that you get some alcohol lingering near the end. Its really good. So well balanced. Personally I liked this one more than the Heady Topper.

Refrigerated aluminum can poured into a snifter. Hazy golden with small white. Aroma is nice herbal hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and good small bubble lacing. Taste is citrus (grapefruit), some herbal hops, and slightly bitter hops.

[can--thanks, Marc!]
Potent c- and tropical fruit-hops aroma: pineapple, resin, strawberry, along with some base malt in the background. Hazy orangey copper under a lasting, thick, white blanket, and with clots of yeast floating around. Flavour is a blast of hops that is somewhat minty with ethanol. Strawberry and resin are stronger than the pineapple and passion fruit. Medium to full body and sweet, light brown sugar balance the assertive, but not quite overpowering bitterness. Medium carbonation, slightly warming, smooth yet dry and bitter ending.

Pours a hazy bright yellow with white head. A citrus hop aroma with pine, malts, and tropical fruits. A smooth body with a sweet taste of citrus, gold, caramel, and malts. A sweet caramel malt and bitter hoo aftertaste.
Wyśmienite IPA od mistrzów z Vermont. Mocno wytrawne, z sosonowo-ziołowym aromatem i bardzo mocną goryczką. Znakomicie pijalne. Świetne IPA.

Many thanks to Thirstybird for sharing! Fantastic floral fresh beer. The beginning is intense sticky, lots of floral fresh piney hops. Intense, sticky, smooth sweetish body. Rich and intensefloral in the aftertaste, fantastic floral and smooth.

Pours a bright hazy golden color with an off-white head. The smell is honey, citrus, tropical fruit and a bit of resin. The taste is sweet light malt, resin, citrusenfibg dry and yeasty. The body is light/medium with nice fine carbonation.

can recieved in a trade. poured a hazy deep golden orange colour with a white head. nose of big earth hop bitterness, resinous, bitter grapefruit, bread malts, citrus, and a hint of pine notes. taste is big pine notes, crisp malt mouthfeel, earthy notes, and citrus. not my favourite from these guys

500ml bottle shared in Rich St. Sourced via trade, with big thanks to Duke. It pours a cloudy golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity and ripe with some bitter grass and melon. Taste is also medium sweet and fruity with notes of melon and peaches with a straight bitter herbal grass close. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, quite tasty

Can shared at the inaugural Matteo tasting, 31/10/2016. Many thanks to Matteo for this one. A translucent golden orange coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma is orange marmalade, sticky hop, alcohol, pineapple, spicy citrus. Flavour is composed of Base grains, tangy pineapple, lemon citrus, Warming alcohol, solvent, pineapple. Palate is frothy. Highish carbonation, alcohol bite in the finish. Not bad.
​Pours hazy golden yellow. Smell is orange citrus, hops, pine and mango. Taste is bitter piney hops, citrus and grapefruit. Medium heavy carb.

Appearance- Hazy, opaque golden with a fluffy white head. Nice lacing.
Aroma- Citrusy sweet, piney sticky hops, Grapefruit, lemon and orange at the forefront with some pineapple and mango mixed in. 
Flavor- Big bitter pine and hop beginning with a nice fruity sweetness to the back end. Orange peel, tropical fruits, nice creamy mouth feel. Very juicy.
Murky, some chunks, aroma is very strong fruit and piney.Medium sweet, medium bitterness, Mango and melon citrus, with some light piney notes, but really really strong. Very good stuff!

Une canette de samedi dernier. Un liquide passablement voilé avec une belle tête de mousse. Un nez, un concentré de jus de houblons verts et de fruits habituellement associés au style. Il y a une certaine démesure là-dedans. En fait, rien nest vraiment délicat mais tout est intéressant. En bouche, la fraîcheur des cultivars donne un grand coup. La résine, la terre, les fruits et les feuilles de la plante nagressent pas mes papilles puisque le sucre est monté en conséquence. Agréable, dans une certaine mesure. Au palais, le corps est impérial. En finale, parfums fermes dun brasseur qui en fait trop avec ses houblons.

Oh my great good god. Delivered out of the blue by the water expert himself.....I fortunately had some lord hobo squirreled away.. to trade with his generous self. He now had admitted himself to the underground beer club...population three. Cloudy with a minimalist head that sisperses to ring of glass. Nascent lacing. Sweet malts then intense pine hops. moderate sparkly tingle of a dwindling finish. Hoorah says the Marine Platoon with resound and gore and guts and veins in their teeth. They pinned a medal on this beer and said "youre our boy" I nice relaxing punch to my senses after a day dealing with pompous DC lobbyists without the proper paperwork. Too bad for them... Alchemist rocks.

Can. 1000 rakes!! Thanks to Tommy for this. Hazy golden woth frothy white head. Aroma is a tropical fruit bomb of mango and papaya mixed in with citrus undertones. Taste is bitter pine, grapefruit, and citrus. Loud bitter finish, with some lingering pine. Considering the ABV, the booze is very well hidden. This is one big IPA. Good stuff, huge in every way possible.
Can. Color hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma sweet, hoppy, fruits, pine. Taste bittersweet, pine, tropical fruits, spicy.

Can at 2016 Big Deck Tasting. This was a yummy fresh can - thanks Rejean! Hazy straw pour with a frothy head. Nice smooth tropical aroma with mixed citrus zest, some pine, booze is well hidden, moderate carbonation and full body, quite sharp but somehow still balanced, easy to drink and a nice dry, citrus finish.
tall boy can. Strong booziness and very sweet. Typical Belgian yeast flavors and strong hops. Finish is booze.
Draft sample at the source. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is bitter pine, vanilla beans, floral. Mild bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Can. Hazy golden with White head, small bubbles. Orange zest, citrus, pine. Dry mouthfeel, creamy. Fruity bitterness.

475 ml can at home. Hazy golden orange color with white to off white head. Hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, dank, pine, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

Pint can from the brewery. Pours a hazy golden colour with a finger of foamy white head with retention and much lacing, some floaties. Quite possibly the best smelling beer I have ever come in contact with; bold citrus nose with floral notes, pine; sharp bitterness up front, a bit juicy, lots of grapefruit. and a touch of pineapple on the back end. A little sticky on the palate. What a monster. Well worth waiting in line for.
Can @ Dangerous Bottleshares vol. ?. Darkish golden pour with a frothy head. Tons of dank hops, sticky, resin, piney, minty, juicy, orange zest and some grapefruit. Gewd!

Can... Pours murky and orange with a golden hue and a mid-sized, fragile, white head. The aroma is a jumbled assortment of citrus fruits, accompanied by a slightly reduced component of pine resin. Medium-bodied to full-bodied and a touch raspy with adequate carbonation. The flavor features a truckload of citrus zest, rinds and pine sap. Heavily bitter with a lengthy, lightly raspy, moderately dry finish. Very little residual sugar is evident here, even as it warms.

16 oz. can.. Originally reviewed sometime in 2014.

Deep orange. Hazy. Nice white head and some wisping. Medium collar.

Smell is very citrusy. Sharp citrus and a little booze. Some cracker malt and pale malt.

Tastes of lots of citrus. Orange. Nothing sweet about it, really. Almost abrasive in its hop profile. Maybe astringent, too.

Very dry. Accentuates the alcohol. Light bitterness lingers. Medium carbonation and body.
As described, its REALLY hoppy and citrusy. Nothing balanced about it at all.

Thx to my cousin. Very strong and enjoyable citrusy, floral aroma. Taste: Caramel, candied grapefruit, punch, fresh grains, muted yeast. Rich, big, clean, and sweet. The head brewer says this stuff can sneak up on you - heed his words. Maybe not as surprising and/or revelatory as TH is at first but another excellent release from Alchemist.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2016 Tap at brewery into a stemless wineglass showing cloudy white orange and one finger of bubbly white foam.

The nose shows moderately intense pineapple and pine.

The palate is medium bodied and smooth but fully carbonated. A lot of sharp resinous pine with citric pineapple softening out the edges. Mod bitterness on finish with clean pineapple on the linger.
A: Cloudy peach coloured with a thin white head N: Pine, passionfruit, overriped mango T: Liqourice, pine, grapefruit, mango, papaya O: Very heavy flavours, but in a nice way!

Thanks to Kevin for this. Man this blew my head off. Pours deeply cloudy golden yellow with a moderate white froth. Aroma is big citrus with a hint of orange. Taste is mind blowing. Tons of citrus, grapefruit and a touch of orange hops. Intense hop bitterness but big malt sweetness cuts it nicely. Pissed off I only have one can.

Has a nice grapefruit, floral hoppy aroma balanced by light malt. Taste is hoppy with some light citrusy fruitiness. Hops linger for a bit in the after taste. Its quite smooth and drinkable for how strong it is.
Recent can from the brewery. Piny concentrated hop delivery. Good drinkability. Hop aromas. Not as complex as expected.Thanks Marten.

2016/09/16 - Pours a hazy deep gold colour with a foamy white head that lingers and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is pine, tropical fruits (lychee, pineapple, mango) caramel, hints of citrus, dank notes and onion. Taste is piney with tropical fruits, caramel, herbal hops and just the slightest hint of alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium to full with average carbonation and a long, lightly boozy, highly bitter finish. I slightly prefer heady, but this beer stands on its own as clean, complex and well rounded DIPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the brewery: Poured a bright yellow color ale with a large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of intense green juicy hops with some citrusy notes is really enjoyable. Taste is a nice mix of green juicy hops with some citrusy notes and some residual sugar notes are also noticeable. Body si about average with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Another superb hoppy creation form this incredible brewery.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Can. thx Alex I guess I owe you a Bj more on that later on. A: litchi, passion fruit, piny App: hazy pale with smallish white head and good lacing. T/p: med body moderate long bitter finish. Soft carbonation. O: Silly me, I?m tasting after having a prospect from Foley..not the brightness choice, now I know. It?s more delicate than Prospect, the balance is incredible. 9% really, can taste it at all. Will need to update it with clearer palate but I am amaze by the overall quality of the brew.

16 oz can shared by drsordr. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have earthy and citrus hops, some tropical fruit, resin, caramel, pale malts, some onion, flavorful, solid brew.

Can shared with alexsdad06 pour hazy gold orange with large white head and small floaters. Nose huge hop, tropical fruit, grass, resin, green onion. Taste moderate bitter bite up front, the huge flavoring hop. Resinous, grassy, and some sweet malt. Love the flavoring hop. Good mouth feel as well. Solid.

From can thanks to Al! Enjoyed from the lovely Crusher glass. Pours a hazy orangy with yeast chunks. Small white head. Aroma has daaaank hops, minty, earthy, light strawberry sweetness, malty. Taste is rather sweet, heavy, orange hoppy, oily, resin, minty. Bitter finish. Oily body and an average caronation.

Can. Pours hazy orange yellow with a white head. Aroma is dank with notes of big fat sweet citrus fruits like pineapple, mango, plenty, herby and slight peach. A rather big and muscular aroma but still with a very low amount of malt-presence. The taste is bitter and planty, sticky resin, orange, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest and slight malt. Pretty intense and big IPA!
Can. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head and lots of chunks. Aromas of citrus, orange, dank weed, herbal, mandarin. Taste is bitter, dank, mandarin, tropical fruits, mango, malt

16oz can poured into a glass. Had this with Focal Banger and Heady Topper. Poured a hazy golden color with an off white head. Citrus, pine, resin, with some sweet fruits. I put this in 3rd behind the other 2 ... but still great.

Pours a slightly cloudy, light orange-yellow (almost a peach color), with smallish head. Aroma is very hoppy--theres some citrus and a ton of pine/spruce smells. Flavor is also very bitter and hop-forward. Citrus, tropical fruit, and piney-hop flavors are all present. Bitter finish. It doesnt quite live up to Heady Topper (as I recall it), but is a very good double IPA in its own right.

Shared 16 oz can.
Extremely hoppy aroma with a far more balanced and drinkable flavor than this suggests. Excellent hoop mix.well carbonated medium body.

Une mousse blanche immaculée dépaisseur moyenne se détache rapidement dune bière blonde et voilée aux reflets couleur pêche. Une ribambelle fruitée explose dans les narines où oranges, pêches et nectarines senchevêtrent pour un créer un bouquet fort invitant. Léquilibre entre une carbonatation juste assez vive et la texture un peu ronde en bouche est à point. Des saveurs fruitées et résineuses samalgament à merveille et sétalent dans une finale légèrement amère et plutôt sèche. Une certaine chaleur dalcool soutient le tout. Des notes végétales en parcimonie mirritent un peu, mais somme toute, cest une DIPA de classe mondiale.

Tallboy can via trade. Poured a turbid light orange with lots of floaties and a small to average sized foamy white head. Aroma of harsh rotting fruit, super bitter citrus rind, bad dough. Flavor is pretty much the same but the rotting fruit is a bit less harsh, sweet alcoholic wort, wet toast, dough, bitter citrus rind. Full body with lots of heat and strong carbonation. Meh..,,,good but not sure why this is the holy grail of DIPAs lately.

Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is really dank and catty with onion, chives and garlic. Taste starts sweet and vegetal, really dank and herbal. Full bodied and smooth. Really good, lots of dank hops and a really good amount of bitterness.

This was poured into a snifter. 
The appearance was a burnt hazy orange color with a slim fingers worth of white foamy head, barely any lacing and kinda messy for what is there.
The aroma starts off with sweet papaya with some mango warming up with some sweet to bitter danky onion.
The flavor starts danky bittersweet. Onion, papaya and mango flow together to combine that danky to tropical fruit bittersweetness. Aftertaste is the same with a quick wet bittersweet finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a nice sipping to sessionable quality about it. Carbonation runs light, feels good. Light throaty hop burn without alcohol burn.
Overall, really great beer, its really worth the hype. Maybe not Heady or Focal level, but this is up there.

Can @ Monkish. Thanks for sharing, Henry! Hazed light orange beer with a white head. This one is a bit better than the Focal Banger in that its not quite as intensely bitter and resinous, but its still a bit heavy on the sweetness and bitterness for me. Big time pine, citrus peel, and herbal hops. Does have some nice grapefruit and plenty of orange juice at least. Its fine...nothing special.
Pours like a pillow. Hazy light orange. Fluffy white head. Beautiful. Nose is stone fruit. Taste is stone fruit, booze, light citrus, bright. Soft. Yummy.
Great beer!! Drink this dry hopped double American India pale ale from the can. Enjoy!

Can, thank you Rich! My last beer of the evening. Drops the hammer with a huge, dank hoppy aroma of citrus, pine, and tropical fruity hop goodness. Really great hop flavors, sweet citrus and tropical fruit, along with a heavy palate slamming bitterness. A full-bodied big bruiser of an Imperial IPA.

Can pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is spicy floral hops. Taste is sweet spicy hops with a spicy holy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sipped from the can during a game of disc golf thanks to N8daGr8 ! Lots of tropical fruits and dank woods notes rising from the aluminum. Palate is juicy with great layers of tropical fruit, citrus and pine sap and a touhc of honey sweetness to soften the backend. Lots of hop punch but a nice controlled bitterness that leads into a dry non abrasive finish !

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur orangée trouble, mousse blanc cassé onctueuse. Arôme de houblon résineux, fruits tropicaux, malt, alcool. Goût de houblon résineux, agrumes, sucré (trop?), alcool, amertume moyenne-élevée, malt, pamplemousse. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

16 oz can shared with ebone1988. The pour is a dark golden orange, thick and juicy with a thick head of white froth that falls down to a thick collar leaving good lace. The aroma is good. There is a huge dank hoppiness and a hefty tropical fruit. The citrus is big and luscious with a nice resin finish. This smells damn good. The flavor is really good. There is a huge bitterness. The juices are lovely. Its got a resounding, yet subtle, bitterness and a light resin on the finish. The tropical fruits and citrus peel really stand out. The mouth feel is good. There is a thickness about it that is really good. The carbonation is excellent and the aftertaste is lingeringly bitter and resin-infused juice. Spectacular.

Can shared with koleminer20. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, dank, floral, wonderful. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, white head. Taste is citrus, pine, tropical fruit, dank, juicier, bitter and nice. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, floral dank fruit aftertaste. Overall, really really good stuff but I still prefer Heady Topper.
Can shared at Todds. Hoppy tropical fruit with pineapple and all kinds of goodness. Want more.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 473ml can, huge thanks to Jan! Pours hazy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of fresh hoppiness, juicy fruits, citrus, zesty grapefruit, herbal notes and dank grassy notes. Taste is massively hoppy, super fresh, juicy fruity and herbal with loads of dankness, grass and citrus. Finish is massively hoppy, lingering bitter and juicy fruity with dank herbal notes, grass, pine and grapefruit. Awesome stuff. Hugely hoppy and fruity, yet very well balanced and quaffable.

Can. Pours cloudy golden / Arnold palmer, small white head, decent residual and lacing. Aroma is dirty orange juice, pine, lots of pith. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, orange juice and pith, pine needles. A bit of harshness and head. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Would love to try this right after it goes in the can.

Lénorme et jolie mousse compacte est ce qui me frappe en premier. On devinera aisément que les houblons sont la deuxième chose à me frapper, et pas à peu près... Cest en effet très, très, intense au niveau des houblons résineux. Extrême bref, mais le corps très rond arrive malgré tout à bien supporter cette explosion amère. Beaucoup plus intense que la Heady, et beaucoup moins balancée, la Crusher a probablement comme public cible les amateurs totalement finis de houblons. Il faut lavouer, cest cependant réussi dans le style : malgré que le liquide puisse se résumer à une grosse cocotte résineuse, le corps est, encore une fois, étonnement capable de supporter le tout. Cest quand même un peu trop pour moi.. Japprécie, mais je ne rechercherai pas à nouveau.
Can shared by a friend. Pours clear amber with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, pine, citrus and tropical fruit. Malty flavor with orange and pine character before a bitter grapefruit finish.
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and pine. Taste is lemon, tropical, pine, and malt. Bitterness stands out. Excellent for sure.

Nose of a good deal of citrus and dank resins, some mild tropical notes as well as a touch of sweat and parmesan cheese undertones. Pours hazy golden orange, nice frothy white head, solid staying power, nice lace. Nice looking beer. Bright juicy assertive citrus up front, dank resin in the middle, a little sweat and parmesan, chewy resinous hops everywhere. Soft malt base with a touch of bread and perhaps toast. Lingering chewy hops. Cool beer. Glad I got to try it!

Can thanks to Jeremy. Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium white head. A big sweet fruity resin hop nose. The flavor is big sweet melon, tangerine, round fluffy soft hops. Very good. No heat. Interesting.

Can from the brewery, less than a week old. 
Crusher Double IPA 9%

A milky honey gold with a filmy white head. Big juicy hop aroma that promises lots of fruity goodness. Medium to full bodied with a round carbonation and raspy mouthfeel.  The taste is quite bitter with a piney edge but lots of levels of fruits. Very nice stuff.

Can (kept cold since purchase). Pours an opaque, dirty orange color with a fine white head that quickly recedes to a ring around the glass. Aromas of fruity hops, mandarin orange, tropical fruit, a slight touch of dankness. A medium sweetness apparent before giving way to a medium+ to heavy bitterness that builds and lasts and lasts -- much more bitter than Focal Banger or Heady. Lacks the finesse of those beers, imo. The high abv is only apparent via the medium+ body. Smooth and a touch creamy. Carbonation is soft. Long, heavy, bitter finish.

16oz can. Hazy pale amber with a frothy white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, lemon rind, grass, pine needles, resinous hops and alcohol with dank notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
From the can. Another nice can. Pine and melon aromas. Soft and smooth with passionfruit and melon upfront turning to resin in the lasting finish.

Can from A nonratebeerian: pours opaque yellow / orange with a white head. Aroma is many hocks of pine and lemon along with no shortage of sugar if poured. Taste is quite, quite bitter. However, it is more up from and not as lingering as some of the more piny and resiny IPAs. Nice.

The return of The Crusher -- its great to see this back in rotation and to finally get a chance to drink it. Lemony and bitter, it reminded me of its sister Heady Topper, but with most of the pine aromas replaced with light citrus notes.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden with a frothy offwhite head. Juicy aromas of tropical hops, caramel, pine. Medium bodied, moderate to fizzy carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Rich malty and floral hoppy flavors into an astringent finish. Perfect IPA.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden beer with a small white head. Intense aromas of floral hops, pine and caramel . Taste is heavy bitter with moderate sweetness. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Dry and astringent with a nice well balanced malty and hoppy aftertaste. Superb.

Pounder can from my neighbor. Pours thick and turbid golden with fluffy, white head. Nose was intense hops, tropical fruit, honeydew, florals. Tastes rich, intense, not sweet, with a great hop bitterness, plus an incredibly complex flavor profile with mango, golden melon tangerine, pineapple, florals, and a super smooth, almost nitrogenated feeling palate. This is an incredible beer. Is it better than Focal Banger? I cannot answer that yet, and that question may not be worthy of even being asked, as two great beers need not be conflicted against the other.

This beer pours a hazy orange color with a medium off-white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of fruity hops, pine and malt. Medium to full body with flavors of resiny hops, tropical fruit and grainy malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering dank hoppy aftertaste. Very good IIPA all around.

Can, courtesy mcberko. Thanks, Matt! Opaque yellow-tan, with a frothy head. Big hop aroma has grapefruit, lemon, just a touch of yeast, passion fruit and lychee. A nice fruit salad of an IPA. Soft body shows sweetness up front but then hits with a lot of bitterness, which has both grapefruity and piney elements. Theres a lingering hoppiness in the finish, with a little yeastiness. The malts are pale and unobtrusive. Well-balanced. Definitely a crusher, which for an imperial IPA is pretty cool.

500mL can, courtesy of both yourilevesque and BuckeyeBoy (thanks guys), pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is bursting with tropical fruits, including kiwi and mangoes, along with some dank hops. Flavour is huge, with tons of dank hops, tropical fruits, including kiwi and mango, and some citrus. So dank and tropical. Fantastic stuff.

16oz can from Jeremy, bottle share on 7/30/16. One of the evenings highlights, where big juicy IPAs were in abundance. Citrus aroma, grapefruit, some pine resin. Citrus carries over to the taste with some caramel malts peeking through , minor bitter bite. Crushable indeed...

On tap at the new Alchemist brewery, second day open! Pours hazy yellow orange, white head. Nose is huge mango papaya malt, citrus, booze. Flavor is big papaya, sweet malt, mango. Big beer / big flavor / big mouthfeel, crusher indeed.

Can to mouth. Nose is super juicy citrus forward. Like fresh squeezed grapefruit with underlying pine. Can is grey and green. Taste is super freaking awesome juice. Tons of tropical fruit flavor a like a starburst. Ho Lee Fuk is this good. Light peppery alcohol in the finish. Super clean and crisp malt backbone. Only slightly astringent in the finish which isnt a problem if you just keep drinking it. Probably one of the cleanest, brightest DIPAs Ive had.
16oz can pours out a hazy orangish topped with a white head. Nose is big grapefruit citrus pine and caramel malts. Taste is more of the heavy grapefruit pithy bitterness and a candy malt on the end.

Pours a opaque blonde with orange hues, tiny head. Big bold hoppy aromas with lime and pine needles shining. Medium bodied, low carbonation, pineapple, citrus, grapefruit and piney Hops shine on this velvety palate. The end is a long resinous, almost garlicky finale, but so smooth on the bitterness side. Awesome take, again, on 2IPA by a master at it.

Can given to me by a friend. Pours a murky pale yellow, small sudsy white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, sweet malts. Flavor had grapefruit, orange, pineapple, hints of mango, and sweet malts. Full bodied, sticky and creamy texture, soft carbonation, slight bitter finish. This is really easy drinking and smooth for being a bigger beer. Focal is still my favorite of the big three, but this is right up there with it. Wow.

A hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, resinous and piney floral hops with light biscuit malt, light pine needles, juniper, very nice and complex. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with loads of resinous floral hops, pink grapefruit, orange pulp, light tropical fruits, very nice and interesting. Can at the Big Deck tasting 2016.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Draught at the new brewery, 7/8/16.Pale, golden-lemon rind colored body shows a good deal of haze, but not soupiness. White head atop is rocky and mostly well-retained.Big citrus and tropical fruit notes are juxtaposed in the nose. Not sure if the more austere citrus or the juicy notes win out, but it doesnt really matter. Stronger malt bill seems pretty predictable, to support the bigger hop character. Gains a strong fruitiness, with a touch of caramel and lots of honey though the hop acids keep it from coming off as juicy-sweet as Focal. Alcohol well-concealed, which is impressive, with no flaw and the hops very, very fresh.White grapefruit, strong tangerine and big pineapple notes mix with a juicier mango character while a highly dextrinous body easily balances the big bitterness. Keeps its head and finishes pretty brightly and with a good levity despite its massive nature. I liked the juicier, softer, lighter Focal but this was nothing to scoff at, for sure.

Pours a bright, murky yellow body with thick white lacing. Nose is strong citrus fruits, pineapple and dank mango. Bright fruity hop-forward aroma that doesnt quite reveal the fact that the abv is approaching nearly 10%. Mouthfeel is juicy hop - a mix of fresh citrus, tropical fruits, and dank pine. Refreshing and a touch sweet, with gentle sugars on the palate towards the finish. Another great hoppy offering from John.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2016 Update: sampled on tap at the brewery. Not too sure if because it wasnt in can or my mood was different but didnt feel the same about it. Thought it was really good but not exceptional like before. Taking away 2 points. Maybe next time I have it in can, Ill update it again. Old rating: 473ml can drank from the can and poured a small glass to analyze the look. Aroma: herbacy, citrusy. Loads of fresh pineapples. App: murky orange, small white head, lacing like orange pulps on my glass. Taste and palate: medium body, crushed fruits in mouth, moderate crisp bitter finish. Overall: wow! This is really good. For having tested both from the can and poured in a glass, from the can wins hands down. Feels more fresh in can, more well blended. This beer deserves this name. It?s really like drinking a mix of crushed tropical fruits with citrus. The mouthfeel is just perfect (from the can). I guess I?ll need to go back to The Alchemist before my vacation to stock up some and use my hide-a-beer fake Monster can to drink it on the beach. A really big coup de foudre for me. Finished the can in the pool. Nothing can beat this feeling.

Hazy orange pour. Nose is grapefruit, other citrus, piney hops, onion. Taste is fruity juicy hops and sweet grainy malt, icy creamsicle, some pickle. Really impressed that theres an evident malt component to this and the hops still shine.

Merci à Marc-André pour cette magnifique IIPA! Le liquide que je verse à linstant dans mon verre est dune densité absolument réjouissante! Mon verre ballon ressemble littéralement à une magnifique orange à jus coiffée dune mousse blanche formée à la fois de fines et de grosses bulles. La mousse colle plutôt mal sur mon verre, mais peu importe. Une BOMBE de houblons; de lananas au fruit de la passion en passant par la goyave. Ça sent le très gros jus de houblons fruités. En bouche, une véritable explosion de zestes de fruits tropicaux dirigés par une amertume présente dès lattaque et quasi interminable. Une marmelade dananas, de tangerines et de tous ces magnifiques fruits juteux et exotiques. Amertume dont on pourrait facilement se blaser jen conviens, cette bière nen demeure pas moins une référence absolue dans le style.

A worthy brother to heady topper. Can from brewery first day of opening. Pours very hazy light orange with some head and some lacing. Nose is juicy, citrus fruit like 5 alive. Flavours of citrus, orange, grapefruit, mango, very fresh juicy. Taste med bitter light/med sweet. Full orange juice type body lively carbonation and lasting bitterness. So drjnkable!
Licht coloured orange brew. A good sized head. Lovely hoppy taste and smell. Good one for sure.
Golden with small head. Mango, peach, mandarin in aroma and taste. Bitter grassy hop taste. An IPA as it should be
This one poured a hazy light orange with a white head. Aroma was of dank and mango like hops. Flavor was similar a little sweet and alcohol shows but still tasty.
Can at BA tasting. Pours a hazy golden yellow orange with a white head. Aromas of pine resin, slightly oxidized hops. Getting older at this point but still awesome.

Ugly silver can shared by MrBarleywine, thanks for the opportunity!
Slightly hazy pale with a decent sized long lasting head. Huge pine and resin with hints of earth and onion. Faint maltiness barely balances here. Resinous hop flavor with just enough crackery malt and a firm level of bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. Fantastic brew!

Pours cloudy orange, white long lasting foam. 
Aroma of peaches, pine, hops, citrus, white grape, fruity. Amazing smell. 
Big bodied taste. Very hoppy, citrus, pine, grapefruit. Amazing DIPA. 
With a very big aftertaste, that remains long long time in the mouth.
Aroma is piney hops. Appears peachy yellow with a head that knocks-off after a minute or two. Taste is piney, little bit of sweet maltiness and some grapefruit.
Very piney hoppy flavor. Light golden appearance. Aromatic grapefruit bouquet. Crispy mouthfeel. Deliciously lingering aftertaste. Solid quality in every way.

Can from last weekends popup sale. Pours a cloudy peach color with very small off-white head and sticky lacing. Aroma is dank and deep, and almost vegetal  in a good way  with tons of tropical fruit, apricot, and candied grapefruit. Taste is sweet mango and lychee with flashes of bitter orange and Sauternes, and moderately boozy, but it still goes down smoothly. Creamy body. Very drinkable for 9.6. Id say this challenges Headys supremacy, with less maltiness and the hops dialed up a bit. Impressive stuff.

CAN at tasting.
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, simcoe, pine, florar.
TASTE: hoppy, simcoe, pine, florar, very nice and balanced.
Bue en plusieurs occasions avec des impressions différentes...mais en général hyper vert, agrumes sucrées et amertume franche sur une charpente blondasse fraîche.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 Blind tasting, of Double IPAs & Single IPAs.

List of Double IPAs, in prefered order: The Crusher, Heady Topper, Pliny The Elder, Deviant Dales

List of Single IPAs, in prefered order: Focal Banger, Grapefruit Sculpin, Mralité/Blind Pig

A  Glowing hazy yellow with a thick head.

S  Super hop juicy, citrus, passion, pineapple, mango, loads of pine aswell, very very very intense and pungent.

T  The taste completely lives up to the aroma, fills up mouth completely and coats it with very very intense citra like hop qualities.

M  Much more full compared to the others, almost a bit creamy, but very very dry.

2017 Rerate, 7-5-7-4-15

13th August 2014Tasting at Jacks RAH Annexe! Lightly hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Airy palate, light fine carbonation. Nice hops - skunky pine, good hop spice, nice light tropical fruits. Light dry finish. Really nice fresh hops in a light airy palate.

12oz can shared by a friend. Pours cloudy blonde with a nice off-white head and a magnificent tropical fruit and citrus aroma. There is a hearty caramel malt flavor with a firmly bitter finish. Sticks to the palate.

Can thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy orange gold with large frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is grapefruit, pine, and hemp. Medium mouthfeel with nice bitterness, hop bite, and resinous finish. Very good.
Can shared by Bruce. Pours copper with yeast. Taste is very bitter with the west coast dipa. Great fruit aroma

500 ml. can sampled @ Pure Apricot Tasting. Thanks! Sampled side-by-side The Crusher / Heady Topper / Rapture / Focal Banger. Heady Topper came out last unanimously. Hazy lemon appearance, creamy white head. Onion nose, dank, very fresh IPA hop funk, Dank, funk, lemon, light onion, cheese taste, funky fresh onion, lemony, Insanely super-easy to drink. Easiest to drink of all 4 must be crazy to session, apparently these are hard to get which makes the session aspect of this one seem a bit silly.

Hazy yellow, medium persistent head. Aromas of citrus, resinous, flowers, nectarine and peach. Flavours announced by the nose. Good mouthfeel. Jaune trouble, moyen col de mousse persistant. Arômes de citron, résine, fleurs, nectarine et pêche. Saveurs annoncées par les arômes. Bonne texture en bouche.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 50cl can, at 9.6%Vol, American brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly woody/floral/sweet, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!

16 ounce can thanks to jackl, 8/10/14! Thanks! Pours a hazy orange color with a thin white head. Fair head retention. Big citrus, tropical hops, dank and herbal notes, pale malt. The taste is dank, citrus, tropical hops, pale malt. Medium bodied, good balance, moderate lingering bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2016 Can shared by Didier, thanks! Pours. Hazy golden and is topped by a light film that leaves some lacing. Nose is of fruits, sugar and cereals. Taste is really sweet, fruity and moderately bitter. Body was medium-full, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel a little sticky. This is just too heavy for me, Id never drink a pint of that by myself I think! Overall this was still nice and worthy of a try.

2016-09-28: A can from a newer batch proved to be less heavy and more enjoyable for that! Bumping to 3.7 from 3.5 as the alcohol is still showing a bit too much but I can see myself going through that can easily.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 16 oz. can shared by Chris - thanks again, Chris! Pours a hazed pale gold with lots of floaters and an eggshell white head that leaves spots of lace and a ring. Notes of florals, citrus peel, soap, pine resin, herbs, and grass. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a bitter, resinous mouthfeel. Like Rapture, this one isnt the most balanced. But I was digging the hop profile in that one better. Re-rate: This is a really unusual beer. The malt profile is toasty and sugary. Theres a rally bitter floral and soapy hop. Honey and grass and hay. Tea and stone fruit. Big and sticky and resinous and sweet and bitter. Odd.

Can. Shared by Didier, thanks! Hazy bright golden with a small white head and light lacing. Aroma is quite resinous with alcohol notes, grapefruits, malt and dank hops. Taste is quite resinous too with grapefruits, malt, alcohol and medium bitterness. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Moderately oily mouthfeel. Dry finish. A tad too heavy for my liking. We had Rapture just after an it was a bitter better. Even The Alchemist cant make a near 10% abv DIPA that I like. Its still quite tasty and even drinkable for the abv.

Hazy golden-orange body, medium sized white head and soapy lacing. Orange zest, grapefruit, pineapple, light resin, soft pale malts. Medium bodied with lively carbonation, semi-dry, lingering bitterness.

Can that drips hazy orange into my glass with medium head and lace. Digging the easier going citra over the mosaic. Pineapple, orange, guava, and grapefruit juice. MEdium to fuller body with healthy carbonation. Nice stuff from a great VT brewer yo.

Tall can of Alchemist "The Crusher" - incredibly delicious and too-smooth-for-10% drinkability.. The hops create a fruit basket of nose and taste. First sip hit my palate like the juice from canned fruit salad (with the cherries, of course). Rare complexity from a double IPA, a bit syrupy as it warmed. An amazing beer.

Can at Chateau Jackl, big thanks to Jacquiline for this number, 13/08/14.
Almost clear orange amber with a moderate off white swirl and edgework.
Nose is earthy hops, light skunko, green hop fresh vibes, bitter orange, citric tinged straw, sweet caramel notes, light mango.
Taste comprises orange pith, red grapefruit, skunky hops, juicy citric pithdom, light mineral wash.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close.
Solid DIPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can at Castle Lowrey. It pours cloudy orange with a nice yellow-white head. The nose is earthy, resin, sticky tropical fruits, mild grassy/herbal, ambergris, skunk and candied fruits. The taste is bitter-sweet, resin, sticky fruits, pine, booze, earth, orange, sticky fruits and green skunky hops with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Punchy, yet drinkable. Very nice.

Can shared in London - many thanks to Jack. Pours clear yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Oh, that aroma is dank, packed with ripe lemon, cat pee, orange, tangerine. Medium sweet flavor, lightly boozy, lots of ripe citrus, some papaya, mandarin orange, more pee. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Resinous and warming to finish, with more dank hops, relatively low bitterness, more juicy orange, grapefruit, grass, mild pine. Dank and lovely.

Can. Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers. Citrus aroma over mild carbonation. Typical superior alchemist complexity in a hop forward beer. Lemon peal, grapefruit and grass flavors. Virtually no boozyness in a 9.6 brew. Delicious.

Can. Hazy gold with a small head. Nose is citrus, mango. Strong tropical fruits. Honey. Taste is similar. Light malt profile. Mango, citrus. Somewhat oily. Good.

Lucky to have gotten these! Another winner from alchemist! But again, I can only drink one of these and I'm pretty much drunk... Hence the name? Fresh with strong bitter hoppiness, piney, golden and fragrant.

Big thanks to Matt for this can. Its citrusy. Really bitter and hoppy. Fresh hops. Insanely fresh hops. Compared to heady, its more bitter with less grapefruit citrus.

16oz can. Thanks to cool Ei8ht Ball bartender for sharing. Just a plain can with a small circular sticker on it. Fantastic nose on this. Huge grapefruit, pine, pineapple, mango, tropical fruit. All in the nose. Amazing nose. Some light biscuity malt, but its mostly all-hop.. So hoppy. Very big bitter taste. Lightly spicy. Light bit of an alcohol bite. Totally hazy golden yellow color. Thin bit of white head. Some loose bits of lace. Chunks of sediment visible in the final pour. Bigger body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Pretty impressively hoppy, extreme DIPA. Almost too hoppy, though. No malt to balance things out, huge bitterness impedes drinkability a bit. Very assertive stuff, but a treat to try nonetheless.

500ml can. Pours a hazy orange with some sediments and a thin, white head. Aroma is smooth. Resin, tangerine. Taste is a medium bitter. Sweet citrus, alcohol, tangerine, resin, pine, and a sweet/bitter aftertaste that drops quickly. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Resiny texture with solid carbonation. Overall a super drinkable iipa. Resin, citrus, pine. Yum.

16oz can shared by JohnGonk. Pours a cloudy orange color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is slightly boozy, with notes of older citrus, pineapple, hints of mango, caramel malt. Taste is also a tad boozy, with notes of older citrus, grapefruit zest, pine, and caramel malt.

can. pours almost cloudy pale golden with a small white cap showing some retention and lacing - chunks ahead. danky and piney fruitiness, doughy and sweetish fruitiness, chewy caramel, touch of dirt/earthy ntoes, peaches, citrus, tropical touch, candied oranges, pepper. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily and sticky, slightly harsh grassy-citrusy-piney finish. danky. piney. boozy. tad overdone.

Tallboy can pours a golden liquid with plenty of stubborn head. Smells like glorious Citra hops: so fresh & fruity. Taste yields the same in droves. So goddamn much Citra hop juice; that fruity hop profile rocks my world. ISO!

Can 16oz.
Pours blond with low-medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, citrus, pine. Taste is of tropical fruits, bitterness, some nuts/earth, alcohol, resin. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Overall: Good, extremely hoppy. A tad sloppy (too pushed?). [Note: Bottom of the can is chunky.]

(can - 16 oz) Hazy orange pour with a thin white head. Grapefruit and citrus in the aroma with some peppery hops under it. Flavor follows the nose. Zesty with lots of spicy and tangy citrusy notes. Finishes clean with a nice and sweet bitter aftertaste.

Cloudy color -- between tangerine and pink grapefruit. Most yeast in suspension some larger darker flocculent parts. Thin fine white foam. Tangerine aromas, resin, cooked apples, pears, mild dank cannabis, more citrus aromas, warming alcohol, herbal alkaloid tequila flavors. Finish is slightly hot and sweet with mild astringency. Some nice diesel fumes and touch of cocoa as it warms. Thanks Ed Hops!

16oz can pours a cloudy gold with some fluffy, lacing white head. Really incredible bouquet of aromas, very grassy, sticky green hops, resinous pine, mild honey, lightly floral, fresh citrus. Flavor is interesting because most IPAs are either really piney or have a ton of citrus, but this really has both, sticky pine sap, really fresh green hop pellets, grapefruit, mango, some pineapple, a little starfruit, fresh key lime. Crisp, bitter finish. Hides the alcohol very well. Really nice.

Trouble, épaisse, équippée de morceaux de houblons, elle émet des odeurs houblonnés à lextrême, très fruités et aromatiques. En bouche, cest du gazon, très fruité encore une fois mais aussi herbacé, végétal, très dans les tons "conifère". Lalcool se perçoit, mais ne fait quapporter une profondeur à lamertume. Excellente, avec de minces défauts (dont le plus important est le manque de subtilité peut-être), mais qui rassasie lavide de houblons, et qui surprend de par son harmonie de saveurs.

Bière jaune / orangée, trouble à lextrême et coiffée dune mince couronne mousseuse. Cest la première fois que je vais écrire ça, mais le nez est amer. Je sens lamertume au plus profond de mes narines et jai juste envie de goûter. Des fruits et des notes herbacées émanent aussi. En bouche (enfin), lamertume est franche et fruité. Un arrière goût dananas surprend et réconforte. Cest lété dans ma bouche alors que les agrumes se mettent de la partie. Quelques minutes sont nécessaire avant que lamertume ne sestompe complètement en bouche. Une bombe de houblons, rien de moins.
Super cloudy golden orange floral and uber juicy nose. Wow. This is an incredibly juicy and sweet beer. Loads of grapefruit. That heady topper yeast. Lovely.
Thanks James. Very hop forward, light malt with a slightly sweet finish. Preference would still go with heady topper but this was pretty good
Can thanks to Dennis. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose and taste of pink grapefruit, citrus, orange peel, light malt, resin, pine and a touch of hop oil. Medium body.
Incredible beer out of can. Smooth beer with piney notes, tropical fruit and nice subtle bitter finish.

16 oz. can thanks to Phatdog1, Thanks. Lasting head on a cloudy gold liquid. Amazing aroma of green leaf hops, tropical fruits and hints of pine. 
Flavor has a bright resinousness undertone with lots of bright citrus hops on top. Grapefruit juice, pineapple and mangos. the bitterness is pretty solid but not overly so, not overwhelming. Light grassy and zesty citrus shows up in secondary flavor. Just enough malt to balance this beer really well. If youre going to try this, make sure the can is fresh because this is a treat. It has a nuance of Heady Topper. 
Im glad Im only a few hours from Vermont, they are the beer capitol of the east coast in my mind. Nice job Mr. Kimmich another top tier DIPA!
Can. Hazy golden pour with white head. Sweet pine and citrus hop aromas. Citrus, herbal, citrus hop tones, ABV is hidden well, nice finish.

Pour is hazed deep yellow amber with a tight white head. Nose grain up front with a ton of hop punch behind it. Citrus is strong with notes of pine and floral hops. Taste is different, lots of citrus and grapefruit with a good bit of herbal and piney hop. Light resin, the herbal/floral note has a light tang and peppery touch. Body is lighter, well carbonated and fairly dry finish.

pours a hazy honey color with a medium white head. aroma has lots of stonefruits...mango, peach...floral...some citrus and some light booziness. flavor follows suit...lots of slightly sweet fruits up front that lead into resin and earthy bitterness...slightly boozy. mouthfeel is medium and the finish is very bitter, resinous and dry...lingering...slight warmth. nice but Ill take Heady over this one.
Quite frankly one of best of high ABV IPAs Ive ever had. Citrusy sappy nose. Nice booze lacing and one hell of body. Reminds me of an even better 90 minute.

Big can in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of citrusy and fruity hops, some pale malts, and light yeasty notes. Flavor the same with a lot of hops and light malts. Average texture. A really cool beer.

Hazy yellow-golden color, white head. Grapefruit, citrus rind, peach, and mango. Light sweetness balanced by orange peel bitterness. Very clean finish - a little abrupt even. Smooth, crisp, and light in body. Practically no alcohol presence

On tap at Alchemist.
Appearance : Clear pale amber with a small head.

Aroma : Nice leafy and fruity hops. Nice white sugar. Nice malt too.

Taste : Lots of malt with leafy hops. Nice white sugar. 

Overall : Quite straight forward but VERY good. Not so hoppy for a DIPA but I like that. It leaves room for the malt to shine. Very drinkable and very clean. Nice malty-sweet finish. Nice notes of white sugar mixed with the fruity and floral hops.

On tap at the brewpub. Poured a hazy yellowish gold with a white head that dissipated slowly to the edges and laced nicely. Aroma was full of a combination of pine and citrus with a backing sweet grain/cookie note. Flavor began with pine, which was joined by a lighter citrus note (oranges) and had a sweet grain backbone. The pine was intense throughout.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Très forte odeur dhoublon résineux et dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pins et de pamplemousse avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Amertume dhoublons en arrière goût. (Rating #2536)

Taster at the Vermont Brewers Festival 2009.  Pale golden with a thin white head.  The aroma is gorgeous.  Bright zesty, citrusy hop aromatics.  Pineapple, mango and a fresh resinousness over a lovely sweet crackery maltiness.  Lots of orange peel as well.  Creamy and hoppy and eminently drinkable.  Excellent stuff.

My Bottom Line:
This soul-lifting Double IPAs fluffy mouthfeel is the perfect propeller for green hop resins and their angelic citrusy fruitiness, a perfume and flavor profile supported by biscuity pale malts and tickled by alcohol.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam decorates the hazy straw yellow, lacing admirably.
-This 2009 batch obviously did not yield the same results as what my Montreal friends had last year. Too sweet and not aromatic enough? This was pretty much the opposite.
-The aroma on this one is pure hop heaven. Citrusy, sandy, resinous, grassy, alleluia! 
-The resinous bitterness is strong, but levelled with the aroma and flavor profile.

On tap at the brewpub.

Pours a cloudy dark gold color with a medium offwhite  head.  Strong aroma of piney hops and caramel malt. Solid flavor of almost aggressive piney hops, theres a decent malt back-bone in there along some sweetness and alcohol, theres moderate bitterness in the end. The body is light to medium with a liquorous texture and gentle carbonation. I liked this quite a lot.

Sampled at brewpub. Pours a light golden/copper color with a white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and some notes of grapefruit. Flavor is light malts, pine, grapefruit and a hint of caramel with a strong bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2009 In short: A intense but highly drinkable IIPA with a bit of everything.
How: Tap at brewpub.  Summer 2009 batch (HUGE improvement over the first batch of summer 2008) 
The look: Clear light orange body topped by a small white head
In long: Highly aromatic hoppy nose with a bit of everything from citrus fruits, grapefruits, pine-tree cones and all.  Body has plenty of pale malts with dry bread and social-tea cookies.  Far from rich and round caramel yet I found this mostly neutral malt backbone totally appropriate to let the hops avalanche express itself.  Hopping is bold and aggressive.  Same elements as in the aroma (citrus fruits, grapefruits, pine-tree cones and all).  A nice dryness sensation.  Strong bitterness.  A huge improvement over the sugary brew with unexpressive hopping that was the first batch.  This is a beer for those who like bold in-your-face hoppy brews, this is The Crusher, not The Polisher.

Draft at the brewpub - Poured a orangish amber in color with a medium foamy head that faded to a small rim around the top of the beer.  Aroma is strong of grapefruit/citrus hops and little else.  Flavor is dominant with grapefruit and piney resinous hops.  This is, perhaps, the hoppiest beer that John has produced... a true hop explosion.  Really good, but the lack of a malt understructure detracts from the excellence here.  Could use some additional aging... might mellow the hop "bite"...  I *really* like this beer!

Objectively speaking:
Rather alcoholic, gritty and rough IPA.

I like:
Very hoppy indeed, but not as aromatic as other Alchemist IPAs. 

I dislike:
Strong  bitterness is accompanied by a certain yeastiness that makes it less bright than Id hoped. Soapy edges. Rather timid malt character.
